'''James Anthony''' (born '''James Anthony Pecchia''', 1955, [[Toronto]], [[Ontario]], [[Canada]]) is a Canadian guitarist, singer, songwriter and [[music producer|producer]]. He started playing the [[guitar]] at age nine.{{Citation needed|date=January 2014}}

==Career==
Anthony grew up in Etobicoke and went to school at Sir Adam Beck, Eatonville, Bloordale, Silverthorne and Burnhamthorpe Collegiate. He went on the road at 17 with The Cougars TCB, one the first Reggae bands in Canada lead by Jay Douglas.

In 1974, Anthony joined Edward Bear and various Toronto bands .In 1978 had one Album on RCA with Mondo Combo.The 80s James played country sessions, TV and radio shows. As part of the Lulu's House Band in the 1990s in [[Kitchener, Ontario]], Anthony performed with over 150 touring artists, including [[Sam Moore]] of [[Sam & Dave]], [[Denny Doherty]] of [[The Mamas & the Papas]], [[Gary U.S. Bonds]], and [[The Platters]].

He hosted an award winning Roots musical variety show "The Midnight Hour" on Rogers cable in the 1990s, and "James Anthony Live" on Cogeco Cable in 2011-2013.

Anthony was inducted into Blues Hall Of Fame USA on September 22, 2013 in Detroit.<ref name="TBHOF">{{cite web|author=Coric Enterprises |url=http://www.prlog.org/12212303 |title=Canadian, James Anthony Inducted As Master Blues Artist In The Blues Hall Of Fame USA |publisher=PRLog |date= |accessdate=2014-06-14}}</ref>

Anthony now resides in [[Burlington, Ontario]] and owns and operates Sound Investments Recording Studio.  He is still active in the blues, jazz and roots music community as a [[session musician]], [[Record producer|producer]], and [[List of arrangers|arranger]]. Anthony writes for and produces other artists, jingles and film scores and performs at blues festivals.<ref name="TBHOF"/>
